name: Argonian Strobe
effect:
The Argonian strobe blinds the fire control scanners of up to three bases or ships belonging to any one opponent for one turn. This prevents those units from firing weapons on the next turn. Cannot be used on the same opponent on two consecutive turns.
- The defending player chooses which three units are affected.
- Foreign technology to all but Argonians.

name: Asteroid Belt - Benakis Asteroid Belt
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫✸✸

The Benakis Belt is a thick band of asteroids orbiting the red dwarf Bena. Bena has no other satellites. The Benakis Belt is mostly worthless rock and ice, but its prime location in the Free Trade Zone makes it useful for many traders, merchants and pirates. The empires also found it a useful system to occupy on occasion.

  • Number: 69
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

The Benakis Belt is a thick band of asteroids orbiting the red dwarf Bena. Bena has no other satellites. The Benakis Belt is mostly worthless rock and ice, but its prime location in the Free Trade Zone makes it useful for many traders, merchants and pirates. The empires also found it a useful system to occupy on occasion.

name: Asteroid Field
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚫⚫✸✸

Asteroid fields are found in many places around the galaxy. They are the remnants of destroyed planets, moons and even stars. All of the empires have established commercial facilities within asteroid fields. These facilities provide a myriad of production and supply services.

  • Number: 78
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

Asteroid fields are found in many places around the galaxy. They are the remnants of destroyed planets, moons and even stars. All of the empires have established commercial facilities within asteroid fields. These facilities provide a myriad of production and supply services.

name: Base Station
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧✧

An empire would deploy a base station when it was necessary to establish a presence in a given sector.
- If operating, a base station doubles the supply output [Modifier Points: 2 x ⚫] of the terrain card it's played on.

✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 4
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: B
  • Strength: 4
  • Point Requirements: ✸
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Black Hole
effect:
A black hole is the final stage in the life of a massive star. The gravity of the black hole is so extreme that even light cannot escape.
- Played on an opponent a black hole does not provide energy points, but drains them.
- The first three energy points [Modifier Points: - ✸✸✸] from the opponent's combined terrain are ignored.
- Economy used as energy will be drained if there are less than 3 natural energy points.

name: Boarding Party
effect:
Illustration: A Corporate Raiding Party.
A boarding party can board (and return on the same turn) a base or ship by transporter or shuttle and do one of the following:
- Cause one point of strength damage.
- Capture a crew card of equal or less strength.
- Destroy an equipment card of equal or less strength.

name: Boarding Party [Corporate Human]
effect:
Illustration: A Corporate Raiding Party.
A boarding party can board (and return on the same turn) a base or ship by transporter or shuttle and do one of the following:
- Cause one point of strength damage.
- Capture a crew card of equal or less strength.
- Destroy an equipment card of equal or less strength.

name: Bolaar Light Pirate Raider
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧

The Bolaar Pirates operated many light raiders. These ships were usually operated by independents with some political ties to Bolaar IV. Light raiders were often hired out by an empire for subterfuge.

{W}: Specialized Weapon Mount
✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 56
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 3
  • Point Requirements: ⚪
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧

The Bolaar are a race of pirates. Generally, these ships were operated by independent captains with loose ties to the Bolaar government. The empires occasionally hired out these ships for combat support.

{W}{W}: Specialized Weapon Mount

name: Breakdown [O1]
effect:
- May be played on base or ship cards of any strength.
- The base or ship may not fire weapons or use equipment cards until the turn after the breakdown has been repaired.
- The breakdown card is removed after the ship has received a number of repair points equal to the strength of the breakdown.

name: Breakdown [O5]
effect:
- May be played on base or ship cards of any strength.
- The base or ship may not fire weapons or use equipment cards until the turn after the breakdown has been repaired.
- The breakdown card is removed after a number of repair points equal to the strength of the breakdown have been applied to it.

name: Bribe Pirate
effect:
- On any turn following the turn played, this card allows a pirate ship (and accompanying cards) in an opponent's fleet to be bribed (function as if they were in your fleet).
- To bribe a pirate economy points equal to the ship's strength must be paid each turn.
- Effect lasts each turn that the bribe is paid.
- Eight economy points must be applied to this card to eliminate it.

name: Captain
effect:
Generated Points: ✪

Illustration: A Mazgar pirate captain.

A captain provides the following benefits to his current location.
- The first damage point of each opponent volley is ignored.
- One less supply point needed to operate.
- Ignore the effects of a tractor beam.

  • Number: 12
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: C
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Leslie Rigley

Illustration: A Mazgar pirate captain.

A captain provides the following benefits to his current location.
- The first damage point of each opponent volley is ignored.
- One less supply point needed to operate.
- Ignore the effects of a tractor beam.

  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: C
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Leslie Rigley

A captain provides the following benefits to his current location.
- The first damage point of each opponent volley is ignored.
- One less supply point needed to operate.
- Ignore the effects of a tractor beam.

name: Cargo
effect:
Cargo is usually stored in pallets and lifted by anti-gravity fork lifts.
- A base or ship card with cargo played on it can sustain one extra damage point before being destroyed. The cargo card is discarded when the owning player elects to apply the point of damage to the cargo.
- At any time the base or ship may use the cargo card as a supply point, discarding it.

name: Comet - Biruk's Comet
effect:
Biruk's Comet is a periodic comet gracing the Bolaar sun once every 17 years. Like all comets it has 2 tails, one a plasma tail, the other consisting of dust and water vapor. Both always face away from the Bolaar sun.

- Comets last a number of turns equal to their strength and are then discarded.
- Comets provide a number of research points equal to their strength each turn.

  • Number: 67
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 2
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

- Comets last a number of turns equal to their strength and are then discarded.
- Comets provide a number of research points equal to their strength each turn.

name: Comet - Indig's Comet
effect:
Indig's Comet is a periodic comet. It requires 81 years to orbit the Corporate System's sun. It was named after an Indirigan astronomer prior to the formation of the Free Trade Zone.

- Comets last a number of turns equal to their strength and are then discarded.
- Comets provide a number of research points equal to their strength each turn.

  • Number: 71
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 4
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

- Comets last a number of turns equal to their strength and are then discarded.
- Comets provide a number of research points equal to their strength each turn.

name: Defensive Satellites [Planet Left]
effect:
The empires would deploy defensive satellites on occupied terrain in hostile areas or locations needing added defenses.
- The first point of damage drops the number of usable phasers to 2. The second point destroys the satellites.

✜✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 2a
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: B
  • Strength: 2
  • Point Requirements: ✸
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin
✜✜✜✜: Phasers

effect:
The empires would deploy defensive satellites on occupied terrain in hostile areas or locations needing added defenses.

name: Deflection/Transfer Device
effect:
- Allows a base/ship which is taking damage to transfer 1/2 (round fractions down) of that damage to any opponent or friendly base/ship. The rest is taken by the unit itself.
- Full damage is taken if there are no other units in play. Cannot damage a Sector HQ.
- Foreign technology to all but Bolaar & Clydons.

name: Doctor
effect:
Illustration: A Krebiz physician at work in his sick bay.
- A doctor causes any illness or injury cards at his location to be discarded.
- No illness or injury cards may be played to a location with a doctor.
- A doctor generates one research point [Generated Points: ☐] per turn. This point is lost if not used on the turn generated.

name: Engineer [Indirigan - no shoulders]
effect:
Illustration: An Indirigan engineer.
- The base/ship on which an engineer is played operates for one less energy point each turn.
- When repairs are conducted at his location, each repair point is doubled.
- Allows the use of foreign technology at his location (maximum of one card).

name: Engineer [Indirigan - with shoulders]
effect:
Illustration: An Indirigan engineer.
- The base/ship on which an engineer is played operates for one less energy point each turn.
- When repairs are conducted at his location each repair point is doubled.
- Allows the use of foreign technology at his location (maximum of one card).

name: Fighter
effect:
Illustration: An Argonian Wind Fighter.
A fighter may do one of the following each turn (or when played in reaction mode):
- Transport 1 crew from 1 location to another.
- May be used by marine or boarding party for one there-and-back mission.
- Fire its weapons.

{W}: Heavy Weapon (once per turn)
✜: Phaser (one shot only)

  • Number: 23
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: R/E
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

{W}: Heavy Weapon (once per turn)
✜: Phaser (one shot only)

name: Fighter Pilot
effect:
A fighter pilot provides a shuttle or fighter with the following benefits:
- Can fire its phaser one extra time.
- Allows a shuttle or fighter to be played independently (i.e. not on a base or ship).
- Ignores the first point of damage from each opponent volley to a shuttle or fighter.
- Can escape from a base or ship being destroyed without a reaction mode card.

name: Fleet Freighter [Front Left]
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧

All of the empires used freighters. Fleet freighters are operated by the empire as opposed to independent operators.
- Freighters are played on terrain cards.
- If operating, a freighter improves the economy of the terrain by 2 economy points [Modifier Points: + ⚪⚪].

✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 48a
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 1
  • Point Requirements: ⚫✸
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

- Freighters are played on terrain cards.

name: Fleet Tug
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧✧

Any empire may use a fleet tug. Fleet tugs are played on terrain cards.br>- If operating, the fleet tug doubles the economic output of the terrain card on which it is played.

✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 51
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 2
  • Point Requirements: ⚫✸

name: Forced Retreat [O3]
effect:
- May be played on base or ship cards of equal or lower strength. Multiple forced retreat cards may be combined to increase their strength against a larger base or ship.
- The base/ship card and all accompanying cards are returned to their owner's hand.
- The retreated cards may be played anew on the owning player's next turn.

name: Forced Retreat [O5]
effect:
- May be played on base or ship cards of equal or lower strength. Multiple forced retreat cards may be combined to increase their strength vs a larger base or ship.
- The base/ship card and all accompanying cards are returned to their owner's hand.
- The retreated cards may be played anew on the owning player's next turn or later turns.

name: Growing Economy [Galactic Intercom #2 Insert]
effect:
A maximum of one growing economy card may be played on any single terrain card.

- A growing economy increases the economic output of the terrain card on which it is played by 3 economy points.
- These points are never multiplied by tugs, bases, etc.

  • Number: 83
  • Rarity: P
  • Card Type: B
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

- A growing economy increases the economic output of the terrain card on which it is played by 3 economy points.
- These points are never multiplied by tugs, bases, etc.

name: Heavy Phaser Refit
effect:
All of the empires applied phaser refits to their bases and starships. Ships are limited to a maximum of 3 phaser points from multiple phaser refits. Bases are not limited.
- This card can be played on any base or ship card. After being played that base or ship has two extra phasers each turn.

✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 22
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: E
  • Strength: 4
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin
✜✜: Phasers

name: Heavy Shield Refit
effect:
All of the empires applied shield refits to their bases and starships. Ships are limited to a maximum of 3 extra shield points from multiple shield refits. Bases are not limited.
- This card can be played on any base or ship card. After being played that base or ship has two extra shield points.
- This card remains in play (even if damaged) and may be repaired.

name: Illness
effect:
- An illness card disables one crew card for a number of turns equal to the strength of the illness card.
- The crew card cannot be used until the illness is negated or its duration expires.
- A number of research points equal to the strength of the illness card are needed to negate it.

name: Injury
effect:
- An injury card disables one crew card until a number of research points equal to the strength of the injury card are applied.
- The crew card cannot be used until the injury is negated.

name: Invinco Guardian
effect:
An invinco guardian is a friendly monster which protects a ship by forming itself into an energy barrier around the ship.

- Must always be played on the lowest strength ship in a player's fleet.
- Absorbs all damage taken by the ship until the guardian itself is destroyed.
- Invinco guardians may not be repaired.

  • Number: 38
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: M
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

- Must always be played on the lowest strength ship in a player's fleet.
- Absorbs all damage taken by the ship until the guardian itself is destroyed.
- Invinco guardians may not be repaired.

name: Ion Storm [H2]
effect:
Ion storms are hazardous zones of hyper-accelerated ions occurring in areas of intense gravitational activity.

- An ion storm causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- Ion storms may only be played against base or ship cards, not against sector HQs.

  • Number: 27
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: H
  • Strength: 2
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

- An ion storm causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- Ion storms may only be played against base or ship cards, not against sector HQs.

name: Ion Storm [H5]
effect:
The hyper-accelerated ions occurring in ion storms make these areas hazardous to ships and bases.

- An ion storm causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- Ion storms may only be played against base or ship cards, not against Sector HQs.

  • Number: 31
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: H
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

- An ion storm causes a number of points of damage equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- Ion storms may only be played against base or ship cards, not against Sector HQs.

name: Krebiz Battle Capsule
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧✧

A battle capsule is a heavy capsule that may be placed on kraken, claw or mandible cruisers. They may also be played alone. Once played, the capsule's strength is combined with the ship's.

{W}{W}: Sabots
✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 52
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 2
  • Point Requirements: ✸
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Krebiz Claw Heavy Cruiser [Dust]
effect:
The backbone of the Krebiz Starfleet. Claw heavy cruisers were designed to carry heavy and dreadnought-sized capsules. This enabled the Krebiz to field the appropriate combination for any specific mission.

{W}{W}: Sabots
✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 62a
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: S

name: Krebiz Pseudo Capsule
effect:
- A pseudo capsule can only be placed on a Krebiz ship that does not already have a capsule attached.
- The pseudo capsule absorbs the first point of damage (after any shields) and is immediately discarded.
- Pseudo capsules are exclusive Krebiz technology. They cannot be attached to non-Krebiz ships.

name: Large Asteroid
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫⚫

There are millions of large asteroids, some in solitary orbit, most within asteroid fields or asteroid belts and a very rare few on chaotic trajectories across the universe.
Such asteroids are often mined for a variety of ores, useful mineral deposits and occasionally for the most rare and powerful of energy crystals.

  • Number: 65
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 1
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

There are millions of large asteroids, some in solitary orbit, most within asteroid fields or asteroid belts and a very rare few on chaotic trajectories across the universe.
Such asteroids are often mined for a variety of ores, useful mineral deposits and occasionally for the most rare and powerful of energy crystals.

name: Large Phaser Eel
effect:
Phaser eels are monsters made of kinetic phaser energy.
- The phaser eel absorbs all phaser fire from the base or ship on which it is played before that fire can damage other units.
- The phaser eel can only be damaged by non-phaser weapons. Five points of damage are needed to kill a large phaser eel.
- Research has no effect on phaser eels.

name: Marine [Gable art]
effect:
Illustration: A Human marine in Corporate service.

A marine requires a transporter or shuttle to do one of the following each turn:
- Kill a crew card or destroy an equipment card at any location except those locations with opponent marines.
- If the crew or equipment card is stronger than the marine then he is also killed.

  • Number: 10b
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: R/C
  • Strength: 4
  • Artist: Ryan Gable

name: Moon
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫⚫✸

As systems become overpopulated the inhabitants are forced to begin colonizing some of the larger moons within the system. Such moons sometimes have terraformed atmospheres. These moons often provide a fair portion of the supply and energy production occurring in the system.

  • Number: 70
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

effect:
Generated Points: ✸✸✸✸✸

The Homecloud Nebula is at the heart of Argonian territory. The star cluster at the nebula's core contains a number of systems occupied by several Argonian republics.

- If an Argonian player has the Homecloud Nebula in play each Argonian ship in his fleet ignores the first point of damage from each opponent volley.

  • Number: 74
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 5

name: Nova [Effect Left]
effect:
Generated Points: ☓

A nova is a stellar eruption in a binary star system containing a white dwarf.

- A nova causes a number of points of damage (indicated above) to a number of opponent bases or ships equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- May only be played on one opponent fleet.
- A nova may not be played against terrain cards.

name: Phaser Refit
effect:
All of the empires applied phaser refits to their bases and starships. Ships are limited to a maximum of 3 phaser points from multiple phaser refits. Bases are not limited.
- This card can be played on any base or ship card. After being played that base or ship has one extra phaser each turn.

✜: Phaser

  • Number: 17
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: E
  • Strength: 2
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Planet - Candor II
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚫■

At the heart of Clydon territory, Candor II is the second of two planets orbiting the white dwarf Candor. This small system is located inside a small white nebula also named Candor. Candor II has a mid-level economy which is based mostly on agriculture. There is some export of machinery and munitions.

  • Number: 75
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

At the heart of Clydon territory, Candor II is the second of two planets orbiting the white dwarf Candor. This small system is located inside a small white nebula also named Candor. Candor II has a mid-level economy which is based mostly on agriculture. There is some export of machinery and munitions.

name: Planet - Vektrea Prime
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚫✸✸

The Homeworld of the Vektrean Mercenaries, Vektrea is a planet of staunch military strategists. All Vektreans are indoctrinated into military service almost from birth. The purpose: To have the most capable for-hire military in known space. Vektrea Prime is the only habitable planet in the system at the heart of Vektrean territory.

  • Number: 76
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

name: Planet - Vorn Ringed Gas Giant
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚪⚪

This ringed gas giant was of a fairly common variety, but the diluminum particles found within its rings made Vorn a planet desired by nearly every empire. Collector stations were placed in orbit within the rings to harvest the diluminum deposits. Diluminum was used in the manufacture of many types of advanced technology.

  • Number: 80a
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Planetary Shield
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧

All empires employed planetary shields to help protect their terrain.
- May only be played on planets, moons or large asteroids. Cannot be played on a player's sector HQ.
- This shield can be damaged by phasers.

  • Strength: 1

name: Plasma Field
effect:
There are two types of plasma fields. One provides energy while the other causes damage.
- When played as terrain this card generates two energy points [Generated Points: ✸✸] per turn.
- When played as a hazard (on terrain, bases, or ships) this card causes two damage points [Generated Points: ☓☓] per turn until a number of research points equal to its strength are applied.

name: Probe
effect: A base or ship with a probe card generates a number of research points per turn equal to the strength of the probe. These research points can be used anywhere in that player's fleet. The research points must be used on the turn they are generated or they are lost.

name: Pulsar
effect:
Generated Points: ☓

A Pulsar is a rapidly rotating neutron star that emits bursts of energy.

- Pulsars cause a number of points of damage each turn as indicated above.
- A pulsar lasts a number of turns equal to its strength.
- Pulsars may be played against terrain, base or ship cards.

  • Number: 29
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: H
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Repair Delivery
effect:
- Repairs a number of points of damage equal to the strength of the card and is then discarded.
- Sector HQ damage may be repaired with this card.
- An engineer can double these repair points if applied to his location.

name: Science Officer
effect:
Illustration: A Voldigar Scientist.

- Generates one research point [Generated Points: ☐] per turn. This point is lost if not used on the turn generated.
- Indefinitely suspends the effects of hostile monster cards at his location. The monster must still be destroyed by normal means.
- Allows the use of foreign technology at his location (maximum of one card).

  • Number: 8
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: R/C
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Ryan Gable

name: Shield Fiend
effect:
A shield fiend is a mindless parasite made up of quasi-energy and protomatter. When one collides with a ship it feeds on the ship's shield energy.

- A shield fiend instantly damages all the shields on the ship on which it is played and is then discarded.
- This card cannot be played on a ship with an invinco guardian.

  • Rarity: R

effect:

- This card can be played on any base or ship card. After being played that base or ship has one extra shield point.
- This card remains in play and may be repaired by one repair point.

effect:

- Transport from 0 to 3 crew cards from one location to another.
- May be used by a marine or boarding party for one there-and-back mission.
- Fire its phaser (only one time).

effect:

There are thousands and thousands of small moons orbiting singly about small planets, in hoards about huge gas giants, and even in solitary paths across the universe. Such moons usually have little to offer, but some mining, energy production and manufacturing will occur.

name: Small Moon - Aldibrik Munitions Plant
effect:
Generated Points: ⚫✸■■■■

Located on the small moon of Aldibrik in the Corporate System, the Aldibrik Munitions Plant manufactures a large percentage of the munitions available in the Free Trade Zone. Several explosive ores are mined, processed, and incorporated into weaponry and ammunition at the numerous factories found on Aldibrik's barren surface.

  • Number: 72
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 4
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

name: Small Nebula - Kalin's Small Red Nebula
effect:
Generated Points: ✸✸

The remains of a star which exploded 1000 years ago. The remaining core of the star at the nebula's center generates enough light to give the nebula its subtle white glow. The red protrusions are hydrogen trails formed by stellar matter thrown outward during the explosion.

  • Number: 68
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 2

name: Small Phaser Eel
effect:
Phaser eels are space monsters which thrive on phaser energy.
- The phaser eel absorbs all phaser fire from the base or ship on which it is played before that fire can damage other units.
- The phaser eel can only be damaged by non-phaser weapons. One point of damage will kill a small phaser eel.
- Research points do not affect phaser eels.

name: Small Planet - Bolaar IV
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚫✸

The small planet Bolaar IV supports most carbon based lifeforms. The only habitable planet in the Bolaar system, Bolaar IV had been occupied by several empires, but finally reached independence during the formation of the Free Trade Zone. Claiming no knowledge of Bolaar pirate operations, the planetary government tries to distance itself from the pirates' illegal activities.

  • Number: 73
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 4
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

name: Surprise Attack
effect:
- Allows one ship card to fire its weapons on the turn that it is played (no economy, supply energy or ammunition points required).
The ship card and the surprise attack card do not count against the three card play limit for that turn.

name: System - Argo
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚫⚫⚫✸■

The Argo system is on the edge of the Homecloud Nebula. The path of this star takes the system in and out of the nebula periodically. It is believed that this unique phenomonon played a factor in the development of the Argonian ability to change from gaseous to semi-solid form.

  • Number: 81
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 7
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

The Argo system is on the edge of the Homecloud Nebula. The path of this star takes the system in and out of the nebula periodically. It is believed that this unique phenomonon played a factor in the development of the Argonian ability to change from gaseous to semi-solid form.

name: System - The Scandig System
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚪⚫⚫⚫■■

The Scandig System is in Scorpead Space near the border with the Argonian First Republic. This large system is one of the major commerce centers on the Far Side of the galaxy. The system has huge gas giants, inhabited planets and terraformed moons supporting both silicon and carbon based lifeforms.

  • Number: 82
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 8
  • Artist: Josepha Haveman

The Scandig System is in Scorpead Space near the border with the Argonian First Republic. This large system is one of the major commerce centers on the Far Side of the galaxy. The system has huge gas giants, inhabited planets and terraformed moons supporting both silicon and carbon based lifeforms.

name: Time Warp
effect:
- A time warp can be played on any card or stack of cards, friendly or enemy.
- The time warp lasts a number of turns equal to its strength.
- The card or cards affected are treated as if they were not there. They cannot be damaged, do not block damage and cannot fire weapons or perform other functions.

name: Tractor Beam
effect:
When a base or ship tractors a ship, the tractored ship may only fire weapons at the tractoring unit. Additionally, damage from this weapons fire is halved (drop fractions).

- This card is discarded at the beginning of the owning player's next turn.
- Only ship cards may be tractored.

  • Number: 18
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: R/E
  • Strength: 2
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

- This card is discarded at the beginning of the owning player's next turn.
- Only ship cards may be tractored.

name: Transporter
effect:
- May be played on terrain (planets, moons or systems), bases or ships.
- Allows any number of crew cards at one location to be transported to another. The transporter must be at one of the locations.
- To board an opponent unit, that unit's shields must be down.
- May only transport crew from a unit being destroyed if played in reaction mode.

name: Type II Supernova
effect:
Generated Points: ☓☓

A type II supernova marks the explosive death of a single massive star.

- Causes a number of points of damage (indicated above) to a number of opponent terrain, base or ship cards equal to its strength and is then discarded.
- May only be played on one opponent fleet.

  • Number: 32
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: H
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Vektrean Light Cruiser - Vektrean Mercenaries Light Cruiser
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧

The Vektrean Mercenaries would hire out their ships to other empires. Once hired, the Vektreans were completely faithful to the letter of the contract. They could not be bribed.

{W}: Specialized Weapon Mount
✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 60
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 4
  • Point Requirements: ⚪⚫✸
  • Artist: Gary A. Kalin

name: Weapons Officer [Bolaar]
effect:
Illustration: A Bolaar Weapons Officer with his collection of rare firearms.

A weapons officer provides the following benifits to his current location:
- Every 2 weapons fired do 3 points of damage.
- Ignores the negative effects of electronic warfare cards.

  • Number: 11a
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: C
  • Strength: 5
  • Artist: Ryan Gable
